AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1604a

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

Text preserved in the squeeze:
1.šhr | hll | yhnʿm | bn | ydʿʾb | mlk | qtbn | ṣry 2.ʾnby | šymn | w-bn | tḥt | šms | w-rbʿ | šhr | ʾdm-s | ʿm 3.br | ʾbn | w-rʾbʿm | bn | ḥyw | w-ʿlym | w-y 4.m | w-ʾwld-sm | bn | snṣfm | w-skt | w-ʾḫḏ | w-gddm | l-ʿṣm 5.t | n-l | ystfḥwn | ʾrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | w-tʾnṯ-sm | w-bny-sm 6.ytn | w-ṣry | šhr | ʾdm-s 7.[… … … …] 8.byt | ʿm | ḏ-lb 9.n | w-l | yhlkwn | w-ṣtdq | ʾrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | ḥg-ḏt | mḥr 10.m | šhr | ygl | w-tʿlm-ʾy | yd | šhr
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.šhr | hll | yhnʿm | bn | ydʿʾb | mlk | qtbn | ṣry [| w-sfḥ | bn | ḥṭbm | mḥrm | ʿm | ḏ-dwnm | w-bn | rṣfm | mḥrm |] 2.ʾnby | šymn | w-bn | tḥt | šms | w-rbʿ | šhr | ʾdm-s | ʿm[ydʿ | w-hfnm | bnwy | hybr | w-hwfʾl | bn-mw | hy=] 3.br | ʾbn | w-rʾbʿm | bn | ḥyw | w-ʿlym | w-y[šrḥʿm | bnwy | rbḥ | w-ʾḫhy-sm | ʾrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | w-tʾnṯ-s=] 4.m | w-ʾwld-sm | bn | snṣfm | w-skt | w-ʾḫḏ | w-gddm | l-ʿṣm [| wdm | w-bntm | w-šftm | l-ʿm | w-ʾṯr=] 5.t | n-l | ystfḥwn | ʾrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | w-tʾnṯ-sm | w-bny-sm [| w-bnty-sm | b-ʿlw | ḏt | mḥrtn | w-ṣr=] 6.ytn | w-ṣry | šhr | ʾdm-s [| ʾrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | w-tʾnṯ-sm | w-bny-sm | b-ṣdq-sm | ḥg | ḏt | mḥrtn | w-ṣrytn | w-] 7.[ʾsṭr-s | w-ṯfṭ | šhr | ʾdm-s | ʾrby | ḏ-lbḫ | l-sṭr | w-ftḫ | ḏtn | ʾsṭrn | b-srn | lbḫ | w-mḥd-sm | b-] 8.byt | ʿm | ḏ-lb[ḫ | b-ḏ-ġylm | w-b | ḫlfn | ḏ-śdw | b-tmnʿ | wrḫ-s | ḏ-tmnʿ | ḫrf | šhrm | ḏ-ygr | ʾḫr=] 9.n | w-l | yhlkwn | w-ṣtdq | ʾrby | ʿm | ḏ-lbḫ | ḥg-ḏt | mḥr[tn | w-ṣrytn | w-ḥg | ṣrytm | sṭr | l-s=] 10.m | šhr | ygl | w-tʿlm-ʾy | yd | šhr

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.Shahr Hilāl Yuhanʿim bin Yadaʿʾab, King of Qatabān, has decreed 2.of ʾAnbay the patron-deity, and on the authority of the protective goddess and guardian of Shahr, for his clients ʿAmmī[...] 3.bar ʾAbān, and for Rāʾibum of the lineage of Ḥayaw, and for ʿAliyyum and Yi[...] 4.and for their children-without any oversight or omission or detraction or cancellation--as a tie of 5.t. So let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons 6.cree. And Shahr decreed for his clients 7.[... ... ... ...] 8.the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Laba[kh] 9.And let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh comply and (thus) receive their due according to this [...] 10.Shahr Yagill might write for them. Signed by the hand of Shahr.
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.Shahr Hilāl Yuhanʿim bin Yadaʿʾab, King of Qatabān, has decreed [and announced from Ḥaṭabum, the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānum and from Raṣafum, the temple] 2.of ʾAnbay the patron-deity, and on the authority of the protective goddess and guardian of Shahr, for his clients ʿAmmī[yadaʿ and Hafīnum of the lineage of Haybar, and for Hawafīʾīl of the lineage of Hay-] 3.bar ʾAbān, and for Rāʾibum of the lineage of Ḥayaw, and for ʿAliyyum and Yi[shraḥʿamm of the lineage of Rābiḥ, and for their kinsmen the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh, and for their womenfolk,] 4.and for their children-without any oversight or omission or detraction or cancellation--as a tie of [friendship and affiliation and protection by ʿAmm and ʾAthīra-] 5.t. So let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons [and their daughters adhere to this proclamation and de-] 6.cree. And Shahr decreed for his clients, [the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons, with their concurrence, in accordance with this proclamation and decree and] 7.[its inscribed versions. And Shahr directed his clients, the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh, to write out and carve these inscriptions in the valley of Labakh and their chapel in] 8.the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Laba[kh in Dhū-Ghaylim and at the gate of Śadū at Timnaʿ-(this in) the month of Dhū-Timnaʿ in the last year of Shahrum Dhū-Yagirr.] 9.And let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh comply and (thus) receive their due according to this procla[mation and decree, and in accordance with any decree which] 10.Shahr Yagill might write for them. Signed by the hand of Shahr.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
Shahr Hilāl Yuhanʿim bin Yadaʿʾab, King of Qatabān, has decreed
of ʾAnbay the patron-deity, and on the authority of the protective goddess and guardian of Shahr, for his clients ʿAmmī...
bar ʾAbān, and for Rāʾibum of the lineage of Ḥayaw, and for ʿAliyyum and Yi...
and for their children-without any oversight or omission or detraction or cancellation--as a tie of
t. So let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons
cree. And Shahr decreed for his clients
the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh
And let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh comply and thus receive their due according to this ...
Shahr Yagill might write for them. Signed by the hand of Shahr.
Restored full text of the inscription:
Shahr Hilāl Yuhanʿim bin Yadaʿʾab, King of Qatabān, has decreed and announced from Ḥaṭabum, the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānum and from Raṣafum, the temple
of ʾAnbay the patron-deity, and on the authority of the protective goddess and guardian of Shahr, for his clients ʿAmmīyadaʿ and Hafīnum of the lineage of Haybar, and for Hawafīʾīl of the lineage of Hay-
bar ʾAbān, and for Rāʾibum of the lineage of Ḥayaw, and for ʿAliyyum and Yishraḥʿamm of the lineage of Rābiḥ, and for their kinsmen the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh, and for their womenfolk,
and for their children-without any oversight or omission or detraction or cancellation--as a tie of friendship and affiliation and protection by ʿAmm and ʾAthīra-
t. So let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons and their daughters adhere to this proclamation and de-
cree. And Shahr decreed for his clients, the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons, with their concurrence, in accordance with this proclamation and decree and
its inscribed versions. And Shahr directed his clients, the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh, to write out and carve these inscriptions in the valley of Labakh and their chapel in
the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim and at the gate of Śadū at Timnaʿ-this in the month of Dhū-Timnaʿ in the last year of Shahrum Dhū-Yagirr.
And let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh comply and thus receive their due according to this proclamation and decree, and in accordance with any decree which
Shahr Yagill might write for them. Signed by the hand of Shahr.

Text preserved in this squeeze:

of ʾAnbay the patron-deity, and on the authority of the protective goddess and guardian of Shahr, for his clients ʿAmmī...
bar ʾAbān, and for Rāʾibum of the lineage of Ḥayaw, and for ʿAliyyum and Yi...
and for their children-without any oversight or omission or detraction or cancellation--as a tie of
t. So let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons
cree. And Shahr decreed for his clients
the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh
And let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh comply and thus receive their due according to this ...
Shahr Yagill might write for them. Signed by the hand of Shahr.
Restored full text of the inscription:
Shahr Hilāl Yuhanʿim bin Yadaʿʾab, King of Qatabān, has decreed and announced from Ḥaṭabum, the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānum and from Raṣafum, the temple
of ʾAnbay the patron-deity, and on the authority of the protective goddess and guardian of Shahr, for his clients ʿAmmīyadaʿ and Hafīnum of the lineage of Haybar, and for Hawafīʾīl of the lineage of Hay-
bar ʾAbān, and for Rāʾibum of the lineage of Ḥayaw, and for ʿAliyyum and Yishraḥʿamm of the lineage of Rābiḥ, and for their kinsmen the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh, and for their womenfolk,
and for their children-without any oversight or omission or detraction or cancellation--as a tie of friendship and affiliation and protection by ʿAmm and ʾAthīra-
t. So let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons and their daughters adhere to this proclamation and de-
cree. And Shahr decreed for his clients, the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons, with their concurrence, in accordance with this proclamation and decree and
its inscribed versions. And Shahr directed his clients, the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh, to write out and carve these inscriptions in the valley of Labakh and their chapel in
the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim and at the gate of Śadū at Timnaʿ-this in the month of Dhū-Timnaʿ in the last year of Shahrum Dhū-Yagirr.
And let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh comply and thus receive their due according to this proclamation and decree, and in accordance with any decree which
Shahr Yagill might write for them. Signed by the hand of Shahr.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
Shahr Hilāl Yuhanʿim bin Yadaʿʾab, King of Qatabān, has decreed
of ʾAnbay the patron-deity, and on the authority of the protective goddess and guardian of Shahr, for his clients ʿAmmī...
bar ʾAbān, and for Rāʾibum of the lineage of Ḥayaw, and for ʿAliyyum and Yi...
and for their children-without any oversight or omission or detraction or cancellation--as a tie of
t. So let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons
cree. And Shahr decreed for his clients
the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh
And let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh comply and thus receive their due according to this ...

Restored full text of the inscription:
Shahr Hilāl Yuhanʿim bin Yadaʿʾab, King of Qatabān, has decreed and announced from Ḥaṭabum, the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Dawānum and from Raṣafum, the temple
of ʾAnbay the patron-deity, and on the authority of the protective goddess and guardian of Shahr, for his clients ʿAmmīyadaʿ and Hafīnum of the lineage of Haybar, and for Hawafīʾīl of the lineage of Hay-
bar ʾAbān, and for Rāʾibum of the lineage of Ḥayaw, and for ʿAliyyum and Yishraḥʿamm of the lineage of Rābiḥ, and for their kinsmen the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh, and for their womenfolk,
and for their children-without any oversight or omission or detraction or cancellation--as a tie of friendship and affiliation and protection by ʿAmm and ʾAthīra-
t. So let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons and their daughters adhere to this proclamation and de-
cree. And Shahr decreed for his clients, the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh and their womenfolk and their sons, with their concurrence, in accordance with this proclamation and decree and
its inscribed versions. And Shahr directed his clients, the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh, to write out and carve these inscriptions in the valley of Labakh and their chapel in
the temple of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh in Dhū-Ghaylim and at the gate of Śadū at Timnaʿ-this in the month of Dhū-Timnaʿ in the last year of Shahrum Dhū-Yagirr.
And let the priests of ʿAmm Dhū-Labakh comply and thus receive their due according to this proclamation and decree, and in accordance with any decree which
Shahr Yagill might write for them. Signed by the hand of Shahr.

bibl.seg: Avanzini, Alessandra 1995. As-Sawdāʾ. Inventaire des inscriptions sudarabiques. 4. Paris: de Boccard / Rome: Herder. [Académie des Inscriptions et Belles-lettres; Istituto italiano per l'Africa e l'Oriente]
